qas.question: In addition to a lack of muscle tone, what is believed to be the main cause of the beer belly?
What condition was attributed to binge drinking in a 2004 study?
What is believed to be the glycemic index in beer?
What is the glycemic index in maltose?
What is caused by overeating and drinking beer?

plausible_answers.text: binge drinking and a beer belly

qas.question: What did a 2400 study find a link between?
Some books quote a glycemic index of 114 for what?

context: It is considered that <a0_0>overeating<a0_0/> and lack of muscle tone is the main cause of a <b4_0>beer belly<b4_0/>, rather than beer consumption. A 2004 study, however, found a link between <b5_0>binge drinking and a <a1_0>beer belly<b5_0/><a1_0/>. But with most overconsumption, it is more a problem of improper exercise and overconsumption of carbohydrates than the product itself. Several diet books quote <b6_0>beer<b6_0/> as having an undesirably high glycemic index of <a2_0><a3_0>110<a3_0/><a2_0/>, the same as maltose; however, the maltose in beer undergoes metabolism by yeast during fermentation so that beer consists mostly of water, hop oils and only trace amounts of sugars, including maltose.
